intro: Arabis karategina, commonly known as the Armenian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Arabis karategina is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
